book.title: Deep Learning
book.author: Ian Goodfellow
Yoshua Bengio
Aaron Courville
book.summary: A comprehensive summary of the concepts essential to deep learning. This book starts with a review of the math needed to build neural networks (linear algebra, probability, gradient descent) then proceeds to discuss fundamental concepts in deep learning such as convolution, regularization, and recurrent nets. The book ends with a discussion of current research topics in the field.

book.title: Deep Learning with Python
book.author: Nikhil Ketkar
book.summary: This is a guide to using the machine learning libraries in Python (namely Theano and Keras) to implement feed forward, convolutional, and recurrent neural networks

book.title: Practical Machine Learning with Python
book.author: Dipanjan Sarkar
Raghav Bali
Tushar Sharma
book.summary: This book is a more holistic coverage of machine learning. The book starts by covering the CRISP-DM model, a framework for building machine learning systems. The authors then cover methods for conditioning data so the best results may be obtained. For the rest of the book, the authors use case studies to introduce various topics in machine learning.
